questions.question: To detect a stuck at fault, error signal must be propagated (must affect the value).This is called

explanations.b: Fault propagation refers to the process where an error caused by a stuck-at fault must propagate through the circuit to affect the output and be detected.

questions.question: ATPG is a tool that can ascertain presence and absence of faults at some locations in the circuits.ATPG stand for

explanations.c: ATPG stands for Automatic Test Pattern Generation, a tool used to generate test patterns that help detect faults in circuits.

questions.question: In order to detect a fault at 'h', we need to provide fault-free logic value at 'h' location.This is called

explanations.a: Fault activation refers to providing a fault-free logic value at a location to activate and detect the fault at that specific point in the circuit.

questions.question: It is always possible to detect a Stuck-at-0 fault using some input values.

explanations.a: It is always possible to detect a Stuck-at-0 fault using some input values, as the fault will affect the output when the signal is supposed to be a logic 1 but is stuck at 0.

questions.question: SA0 present at a location means the signal passing through that line

explanations.b: A Stuck-at-0 (SA0) fault means the signal passing through that line is permanently stuck at logic 0, regardless of the intended input.
